channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.description:
Report X-2024050500

item.title: Report X-2024050386
item.description:
Report X-2024050386

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-04
  • City: BROOKLYN
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2113
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hazardous Materials Manager Tom Robinson received a call that there was an odor in the departure yard in Livonia. Manager Robinson responded and began searching for the odor. He found TILX 301778 had a small leak coming from the liquid valve where it is bolted to the pressure plate. Manager Robinson tightened the valve mounting bolts and the leak stopped. Manager Robinson called the shipper and told them to get an OTMA because the car leaked below the valve body.
